page.title: 07THE ENVIRONMENTAL CENTRE
page.content: The Hams Hall centre was opened in 1975 following several years of converting the site into a nature reserve & educational centre. The area chosen for the classroom & wardens office was originally the walled garden of the Hams Hall Country Estate . A teacher warden is employed to ensure that full benefit is gained from educational visits. Church Pool Covert is the main study area & is rich in many varieties of flora & fauna. Various trails are planned out for visitors. Many recently planted trees were to replace trees lost through Dutch Elm Disease. The cost of running the centre is shared by Birmingham City Council, Warwicksire County Council & Solihull Metropolitan Borough Council.
